issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: "Create new volume" dialog fails to assign name to volume.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: In create volume with name automated test volume name fails to appear on Volumes landing page

comments.body:
[~alice]: I investigated this a bit and noticed webdriver hangs on initial loading of the browser for some reason.  When I manually enter http://localhost:8888 in the browser, the automated tests kick into gear and the suite completes just fine.  Need to dig some more to pinpoint the cause.

I'm using...
python ./runtest_volume.py 10.111.1.136 -p 8888 127.0.0.1 -a ui-test-acct-00 -u user00 -w mypassword1 -t create_volume_name_v

BTW, I added a few sys.path convenience calls and a pip requirements file to get se34euca up and running more easily for a given dev/test environment.  The commit is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/se34euca/commit/6b2398940077b80895d91d06827f20901ac633f4 , and I'll probably open a pull request for that, hopefully after I track down this issue.

[~alice]: I'm an idiot.  My localhost wasn't responding to https, so adding the --protocol flag allows the testrun to proceed locally...
python ./runtest_volume.py 10.111.1.136 -p 8888 127.0.0.1 -a ui-test-acct-00 --protocol http -u user00 -w mypassword1 -t create_volume_name_v

Continuing to investigate, but I don't see a failure or error in the volume runtest.

Hi [~kgill], I noticed that you used the 10.111.1.136 as your ui IP. This is the IP of our production cloud which runs UI 3.2 or 3.3.
I was seeing the test failure in UI 3.4. I have a setup that you can use to investigate: https://10.111.1.173:8888/ feel free to use ui-test-acct-03/user00 if you don't know the password, I'll give it to you on IRC
HI [~kgill], I think EUCA-7768 is related to this. EUCA-7768 can be reproduced by hand.
This test is now broken in Selemoium IDE as well. Can be reproduced with  create_volume_v test from selenium IDE suite.  I increased priority of this bug to critical.
On a freshly built setup could reproduce manually as well. Updated status to blocker.

On a freshly built setup https://10.111.5.67:8888 naming volumes in the "Create volume" dialog did not work.  When I looked in the firebug I did not see any evidence that the name tag was created at all.

Here is the system link to the setup. http://10.111.1.120/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=alice-ui-test-new&uid=1025&prev_page=http%3A%2F%2F10.111.1.120%2Feuca-qa%2Fstart_test.php&Refresh=Refresh

[~alice], [~dkavanagh], [~jpommer]:   Looks like the test hangs in the Create Volume dialog since the availability zone drop-down isn't populated, preventing the Create Volume button from being activated.  No clue why the availability zone drop-down isn't working there, since it appears to work in manual testing.

Tested with this command...
python ./runtest_volume.py 10.111.5.78 -p 8888 127.0.0.1 -a ui-test-acct-00 --protocol http -u user00 -w mypassword1 -t create_volume_name_v
Hi [~kgill], Please note that this issue can not really be tested because of EUCA-7772
[~kgill], AZ is hard coded in the automated test to PARTI00, I will remove the hardcoded AZ today from python tests the way I did for Selenium IDE tetsts.
[~jpommer]: Assigned this one to you since it's blocked by EUCA-7772.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/pull/130

This reverts EUCA-6576.
Reassigned reviewer to [~dkavanagh]
Tested on 2 fresh builds manually. Create volume dialog does not create a name tag for newly created volume.

Cannot reproduce in dev environment. Tested against CLC 10.111.5.78 and 10.101.1.36.
10.111.5.78 is doing some really bizarre things right now.
[~alice] - Can you arrange access to one of the affected test machines for me?

Hi Jerry, 
could you try  https://10.111.1.178:8888 usual users. I tested for ui-test-acct-00/user00 on Firefox and Chrome.

Hey David,

We are out of BF hours and need to pick up the slack internally. Thanks!

[~alice] - That machine doesn't have the same code as testing does. This commit:

commit df4b5e49e91c4980d84c26429ee7d6ba040b4c1a
Author: Jerry Pommer <jpommer@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 7 20:54:24 2013 -0500

    EUCA-7732
    This reverts the change for EUCA-6576, which was the cause of this issue.

Is in testing, but apparently not in the branch that this machine was built from. It was pull request #130, as in the comment from last week. Here is the diff:
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console/commit/df4b5e49e91c4980d84c26429ee7d6ba040b4c1a
Hi [~jpommer], this setup was built from packages yesterday. Clearly, the commit you mentioned was not in. Thanks for digging into this!
Verified on POC setup in Firefox.
